      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                             android.view.ViewGroup container,
                             android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Description copied from class: GridFragment
        Provide default implementation to return a simple grid view. Subclasses can override to replace with their own layout. If doing so, the returned view hierarchy must have a GridView whose id is android.R.id.list and can optionally have a sibling view id android.R.id.empty that is to be shown when the list is empty.

        If you are overriding this method with your own custom content, consider including the standard layout R.layout.list_content in your layout file, so that you continue to retain all of the standard behavior of GridFragment. In particular, this is currently the only way to have the built-in indeterminant progress state be shown.

        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class GridFragment

      • onGridItemClick

        public void onGridItemClick(android.widget.GridView l,
                   android.view.View v,
                   int position,
                   long id)
        Description copied from class: GridFragment
        This method will be called when an item in the grid is selected. Subclasses should override. Subclasses can call getGridView().getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access the data associated with the selected item.
        Overrides:
        onGridItemClick in class GridFragment
        Parameters:
        l - The GridView where the click happened
        v - The view that was clicked within the GridView
        position - The position of the view in the grid
        id - The row id of the item that was clicked
